pullRequest.title: [#10176] Fix student tables not responding to changes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Part of #10176
Outline of Solution
For deleting all students from the course details page, the sections was not resetted before fetching the updated data from backend. However, we could also simply reset the sections variable directly in the frontend and update statistics to 0 since it is guaranteed; saving one backend call. Would that be better?
For single deletes, the IterableDiffer in student list component only tracked the changes made to sections but did not track changes made to the list of students inside the section. Added tracking of list of students. Also updated the statistics that were being shown on the respective pages.
For the enroll students page, moved the second subscription to when the first one is completed before updating the table
Update

Added in a StatisticsCalculatorService that holds logic for calculating course statistics from list of students.
Refactored student-list-component to accept an already flattened list of students instead of having the component itself detect changes and flatten the list.
Removed the change detection code
Updated components which use the student-list-component to pass in a flat list of students
Added an additional flattening of data in the search-component. Probably better to do flattening in component instead of the search-service itself.

nodes.bodyText: I think you somehow want to write a common method for stats calculation because the stats calculation code is duplicated in loadStudents.
Same here. Duplicated code in loadStudents()

Personally, I don't like to touch the low-level change detection in Angular as this is prone to errors. Even this is done before, it is still necessary to have one StudentListSectionData outside and one FlatStudentListData inside?
In other word, can we just construct FlatStudentListData (actually we should call it as StudentListRowModel) outside?
I think you can put the method into StudentsService or CourseService.
Let's take this chance and put the component into src/web/app/components
The privilege is loaded per section so you don't want to apply the privilege to all students (i.e., you need to apply the privilege to student in the sectionName).

Many redundant calculations are going here (though it will provide correct result eventually). I think the correct way to do it is to construct StudentListRowModel when all students are loaded. After that, we can begin to load privilege for each section.
It looks like we should also change the search service also. Let's leave it to another PR. Please raise an issue afterward or continue do it afterward :P.
The section name should be 'Tutorial Group 1' for all?
Same here. The privilege is not loaded correctly for each section.
Same here. The stats calculation should be not here.
In addition, let's not couple the model data and the business logic (services) together. Can we take Student[] as arguments?

nodes.bodyText: Why we discard the old method? loadStudents again will cause another unnecessary API request.
There is a cleaner way of writing this by using map.
Same here
If we delete all student, we can actually just clear the list (by setting to [])
Let's make sure that StudentListSectionData is only used in the search service.

For your question:
I think you can actually define a new field: student: Student here (and delete other student related fields). Store the model in the corresponding page. When stats is calculated, use the student field to construct a list of student.
